‚ÄúLike me, you might be thinking, "I don't have trauma", or that trauma is reserved for people with mental health issues or serious problems. That miconception means a lot of people miss out on the treasure that can be found in doing trauma work." This is a sneak peek from the opening chapter of ‚ÄúA BIGGER MISSION‚Äù: the upcoming book written by me and 11 other badass professionals who profoundly care about demystifying trauma and facilitating your transformation. This book is jam packed full of wisdom authenticity, realness, rawness and insights on how trauma holds you back, and also how you hold the key to your freedom. Pre-register now to receive your free gift, ‚ÄúThe 3 Secrets To Unlocking What‚Äôs Holding You Back‚Äù, which will be sent when the book launches later this month. Register here: https://lnkd.in/eJX6U8MR #abiggermission #abiggermissionbook #traumahealing #spiritualgrowth #innerhealing #lifepurpose #burnoutrecovery #emotionalhealing #selfdiscovery #transformationaljourney #trauma #MentalHealth #Healing #EmotionalWellness #Therapy #SelfCare #TraumaRecovery #MentalHealthAwareness

Learning about and caring for our mental health can start at an early age. Natasha N. Goss, a Doc Wayne Champions Network Facilitator¬Æ and author wrote a book that tackles big feelings, based on her own experiences with young children learning to handle sometimes difficult emotions. Watch to learn more about the inspiration behind her first children's book. https://lnkd.in/etvXp6ne #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth #MHAM2024

This is our review of James Sells, Heather Sells, and Amy Trout's book that furthers the conversation on integrating Church and mental health more. Spoiler: we HIGHLY recommend it for any church wanting to start or grow their church's mental health ministry or Christian counselors wanting to do more effective work alongside the Church. To read the full review and where you can get your own copy, click the link below: https://lnkd.in/eJrJTQ-B #counseling #pastoralcounselor #christiancounselor #christiancounseling #mentalhealthmatters #mentalhealthawareness #mentalhealthandthechurch #pastoralcounseling #bookreview #book #booknerd

Sharing your journey about mental health is not always easy, but it's necessary. In my co-authored book 'The Decision to Heal: Pathways from Suffering to Love,' I've poured my heart and experiences into its pages, along with other remarkable voices. Join me in breaking the silence. Let's use our stories to illuminate the path to healing and encourage others to speak their truths. Together, we can start the conversations that matter most. üó£Ô∏èüí™ üìö Grab a copy of the book in my bio and let's embark on this journey together. #MyStory #BreakTheSilence #StartingDifficultConversations #MentalHealthMatters #NavigateYourFreedom #Storytellingsaveslives #Author #suicidepreventionawarenessmonth #YouMatter #EndtheStigma

Today is Stress Awareness Day, and it's the perfect time to highlight the significance of mental well-being. üíô We've put together a booklet, where you'll discover insightful information about the four common signs of stress and ways to find relief. We've also curated a collection of valuable resources and links to equip you with the knowledge and tools to combat stress. Don't forget to download it to access the links üí™ Our commitment to building a supportive community that thrives on authenticity and personal growth is crucial (as per our C.I.R.C.L.E values!) Has this booklet been helpful for you? Let us know down below! #stressawarenessday #mentalhealth #community #stressrelief
